columns.text: In this problem, we need to solve for the adjusted cash flows per year as well as the net present value based on the changes in the data.

For this problem, instead of using the straight-line method of computing for the depreciation, we will use the Modified Accelerated Cash Recovery System method. With this, the depreciation will not be the same for each year. 
This can be solved using this table:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Year 1}&=0.333\\
\text{Year 2}&=0.445\\
\text{Year 3}&=0.1481
\end{aligned}$$
To solve for the cash flow for each year, we can simply take the annual profit of $\$1,735,000$ and multiply it to $1$ minus the tax rate. After which, we will add the depreciation to it.

For each year, the profit after tax will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Profit after tax}&=\$1,735,000 \times (1-0.21)\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,370,650
\end{aligned}$$

Each year, we will have a profit of $\$1,370,650$

For **Year 1**, we first need to solve for the depreciation by multiplying the initial investment by the corresponding factor in Step 1.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$2,320,000 \times 0.333\\[15 pt]
&=\$772,560
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation in Year 1 is $\$772,560$

To get the cash flow for this year, we will simply add the profit after tax to the depreciation.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cash flow}&=\$1,370,650+\$772,560\\[15 pt]
&=\$2,143,210
\end{aligned}$$

The cash flow at Year 1 is $\$2,143,210$

Again, we will use the present value of the cash flow which means we will multiply the cash flow by the factor of $0.71178$. This means that the present value cash flow will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value cash flow}&=\$2,143,210 \times 0.71178\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,525,494.01
\end{aligned}$$

The present cash flow value for **Year 1** is $\$1,525,494.01$

For **Year 2**, we first need to solve for the depreciation by multiplying the initial investment by the corresponding factor in Step 1.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$2,320,000 \times 0.445\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,032,400
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation in Year 2 is $\$1,032,400$

To get the cash flow for this year, we will simply add the profit after tax to the depreciation.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cash flow}&=\$1,370,650+\$1,032,400\\[15 pt]
&=\$2,403,050
\end{aligned}$$

The cash flow at Year 2 is $\$2,403,050$

Again, we will use the present value of the cash flow which means we will multiply the cash flow by the factor of $0.71178$. This means that the present value cash flow will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value cash flow}&=\$2,403,050\times 0.71178\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,710,442.93
\end{aligned}$$

The present cash flow value for **Year 2** is $\$1,710,442.93$

For **Year 3**, we first need to solve for the depreciation by multiplying the initial investment by the corresponding factor in Step 1.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\$2,320,000 \times 0.1481\\[15 pt]
&=\$343,592
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation in **Year 3** is $\$343,592$

To get the cash flow for this year, we will simply add the profit after tax to the depreciation as well as the after-tax salvage value and the net working capital in the previous problem.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cash flow}&=\$1,370,650+\$343,592+\$142,200+\$250,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$2,106,442
\end{aligned}$$

The cash flow at Year 3 is $\$2,106,442$

Again, we will use the present value of the cash flow which means we will multiply the cash flow by the factor of $0.71178$. This means that the present value cash flow will be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value cash flow}&=\$2,106,442\times 0.71178\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,499,323.29
\end{aligned}$$

The present cash flow value for Year 3 is $\$1,499,323.29$

To solve for the net present value, we will use this formula:

$$\begin{aligned} \text{Net present value}&=\sum\dfrac{\text{Present value cash flow}}{(1+\text{required return rate})^\text{time}} \end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Net present value}&=\dfrac{-\$3,000,000}{(1-0.12)^0}+\dfrac{\$1,525,494.01}{(1-0.12)^1}\\
&+\dfrac{\$1,710,442.93}{(1-0.12)^2}+\dfrac{\$1,499,323.29}{(1-0.12)^3}\\[15 pt]
&=\$3,142,373.61
\end{aligned}$$

The Net present value of this project is now $\$3,142,373.61$
